title: The Black Douglas
author: Crockett, S. R. (Samuel Rutherford)
snippet: Would toGod I had slain her with my hand! Tell the Earl that if he will notcome to those that wait for him underneath the tower, I, MaliseMacKim, will come and fetch him like a child in my arms, even as I didfrom under the pine trees at Loch Roan."

title: The Black Douglas
author: Crockett, S. R. (Samuel Rutherford)
snippet: The smith looked a little nonplussed, but stuck to it stoutly thatnone but a witch woman would ride alone at nightfall upon a Gallowaymoor, or unless by enchantment set up a pavilion of silk and strangedevices under the pines of Loch Roan.

title: The Black Douglas ... Second impression.
author: Crockett, Samuel Rutherford.
snippet: The smith looked a little nonplussed, but stuck to itstoutly that none but a witch woman would ride aloneat nightfall upon a Galloway moor, or unless by enchantment set up a pavilion of silk and strange devicesunder the pines of Loch Roan.
